page.title: 09SEVERN VALLEY WOODWORKS
page.content: This is one of the few light industries of the area and is situated alongside the A48 trunk road. It employs 42 people and produces packing cases to house rifles and warheads (Ministry of Defence) and pallettes (for Heinz - major producer of food - not local). The woodworks use only softwoods, all from other countries (Russia,Poland,Sweden, Ireland,Canada) and it uses 4 forklift trucks and 2 lorries (32 tonnes). Various saws are used: bandsaw (10ft long),circular (6ft diameter) and modern methods are employed for joining wood together - high-velocity nail guns.Fifteen packing cases and 20 pallettes are made, on average, each day. The woodworks, still known as 'the coffin works', is housed in four different buildings each used for a different aspect of the production.
